subject: Free Agents (Sports)
lead_paragraph: The often-injured Derrick Ward re-signed with the Giants, reuniting with the halfbacks who replaced Tiki Barber and helped the team to a Super Bowl title.Terms were not immediately available. Ward, who was an unrestricted free agent, rushed for 602 yards and 3 touchdowns before breaking his left leg Dec. 2 in a game against the Chicago Bears. He also caught 26 passes for 179 yards and a touchdown.“The Giants gave me my start,” said Ward, who shared the halfback role with Brandon Jacobs, Ahmad Bradshaw and Reuben Droughns. “It feels good to come back to hopefully have a good year this year and be a part of the Super Bowl champion Giants.”.
